_documentation.description: Advanced MCP configuration examples for different environments

configurations.local: For local development with Vrooli running on localhost
configurations.remote: For connecting to a remote Vrooli instance

environment_variables.VROOLI_API_KEY: API key for local Vrooli instance
environment_variables.VROOLI_REMOTE_URL: Base URL for remote Vrooli server (e.g., https://vrooli.example.com)
environment_variables.VROOLI_REMOTE_API_KEY: API key for remote Vrooli instance

server_selection: Enable only one server configuration at a time
Use 'disabled': true to temporarily disable a server
Remote is suitable for production workflows
docker_notes: Use host.docker.internal instead of localhost when running Claude Code outside Docker
If Claude Code is also in Docker, use the container name or service name
Ensure port 3000 is exposed from the Vrooli container

troubleshooting.connection_refused: Check if Vrooli server is running and accessible
troubleshooting.authentication_failed: Verify API key is correct and has necessary permissions
troubleshooting.timeout_errors: Check network connectivity and firewall settings
troubleshooting.cors_errors: Ensure Vrooli server allows connections from Claude Code's origin

performance_tips: Use local connections when possible for better performance
Set appropriate timeouts for remote connections
Use connection pooling for high-volume usage
